clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Study of Lisinopril in Children and Adolescents With a Kidney Transplant
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Pharmacokinetics of Lisinopril in Pediatric Kidney Transplant Recipients

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock:
The drug lisinopril is approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for the treatment of high blood pressure, heart failure, and acute heart attacks in adult patients. In children over 6 years of age, lisinopril is approved for the treatment of high blood pressure. Lisinopril is in a group of medications called angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors (ACE). ACE inhibitors such as lisinopril work by decreasing certain chemicals that tighten the blood vessels so blood flows more smoothly and the heart can pump blood more efficiently.
There is some information available about how children with high blood pressure absorb, distribute, metabolize, and eliminate lisinopril (this information about medication processing by the body is called pharmacokinetic data). However, there is no information about how children with high blood pressure who have received a kidney transplant process lisinopril. In addition to decreasing blood pressure, investigators believe that lisinopril may help kidney transplants work longer by reducing the activity of chemicals made by cells in kidney transplants that can lead to inflammation and injury. Such benefits have not been found with another group of blood pressure medications called calcium channel blockers, which are the most commonly used medication group to control high blood pressure in children after a kidney transplant. A clinical trial will be conducted in the future to compare which medication group helps kidney transplants in children last longer. To guide the selection of the best dose to test in future studies, investigators in this study will try to determine the safety profile, dose tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of lisinopril in children and adolescents (2-17 years of age) who have received a kidney transplant and have high blood pressure.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK) - Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 14 (+/- 3 days) of lisinopril therapy at hours 0 (pre-dose) and 1,2,4,5,8,12 and 24 hrs after dose
primary_outcome.description: At the Day 14 (±3 days) visit, blood (1 mL) will be collected at 0 hour (pre-dose) and at 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 12 and 24 hours post-lisinopril dose for determination of AUC. Geometric mean was calculated from all measurements.

primary_outcome.measure: PK - Maximum Observed Concentration of Drug in Plasma (Cmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day14 (+/- 3 d) of dose at 0 hour and 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 12, and 24 hrs after dose
primary_outcome.description: At the Day 14 (±3 days) visit, blood (1 mL) will be collected at 0 hour (pre-dose) and at 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 12 and 24 hours post-lisinopril dose for determination of Cmax. Geometric mean was calculated from all measurements.

primary_outcome.measure: PK - Time of the Maximum Observed Concentration in Plasma (Tmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 14 (+/- 3 d) of dose at 0 hour and 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 12, and 24 hrs after dose
primary_outcome.description: At the Day 14 (±3 days) visit, blood (1 mL) will be collected at 0 hour (pre-dose) and at 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 12 and 24 hours post-lisinopril dose for determination of plasma lisinopril concentration. Medium was calculated from all measurements.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 14 (+/- 3 d) of dose at 0 hour and at 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 12, and 24 hrs after dose
primary_outcome.description: At the Day 14 (±3 days) visit, blood (1 mL) will be collected at 0 hour (pre-dose) and at 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 12 and 24 hours post-lisinopril dose for determination of CL/F. Geometric mean was calculated from all measurements.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 14 (+/- 3 d) of dose at 0 hour and 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 12, and 24 hrs after dose.
primary_outcome.description: At the Day 14 (±3 days) visit, blood (1 mL) will be collected at 0 hour (pre-dose) and at 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 12 and 24 hours post-lisinopril dose for determination of CLrenal. Geometric mean was calculated from all measurements.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) During/After Study Drug Administration
primary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study drug to 30 days after final study visit for AEs and until resolution for SAEs
primary_outcome.description: Number of Adverse Events (AEs) related and not related to study drug; number of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) related and not related to study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Potassium Level From Baseline in Lisinopril-naive Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline visit and Day 14 prior to final study dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Potassium values will be obtained at Baseline and Day 14 prior to the final dose of study drug. Mean calculated from the two measurements.

secondary_outcome.measure: Worse Post-dose Decrease in Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) From Baseline in Lisinopril-naive Participants
secondary_outcome.description: The eGFR at entry will need to be ≥ 30 ml/min/1.73m^2 to minimize concerns about an acute angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors (ACE-I)-mediated reduction in kidney function. eGFR ratio was computed from the worst post-dose value divided by the Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Largest eGFR Percent Decrease From Baseline in Lisinopril-naive Participants
secondary_outcome.description: The eGFR at entry will need to be ≥ 30 ml/min/1.73m^2 to minimize concerns about an acute angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor (ACEI) mediated reduction in kidney function. Largest eGFR percent decrease from baseline reported in results section.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Urine Protein/Creatinine From Baseline in Lisinopril-naive Participants.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to worst post-dose before Day 14 (+/- 3 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in urine protein/creatinine obtained as follows: Mean change (worst post-dose from baseline) presented for urine protein/creatinine ratio. Geometric mean of the ratio (worst post-dose / baseline with Geometric Coefficient of Variation percent (CV%) and greatest decrease presented for eGFR by dose group. Two patients in the high dose group had an evaluable urine protein/creatinine change.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure From Baseline in Lisinopril-naive Participants
secondary_outcome.description: Ambulatory blood pressure readings were measured during the baseline/pre-study dose period using a SpaceLabs (Redmond, WA) device at home to avoid the confounding effects of venipuncture and abnormal sleep pattern. Another blood pressure reading was performed at 1 day before the final dose of lisinopril (day before the last scheduled visit). The mean of these measurements was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure From Baseline in Lisinopril-naive Participants
secondary_outcome.description: Ambulatory blood pressure readings were measured during the baseline/pre-study dose period using a SpaceLabs (Redmond, WA) device at home to avoid the confounding effects of venipuncture and abnormal sleep pattern. Another blood pressure reading was performed at 1 day before the final dose of lisinopril (day before the last scheduled visit). The mean from these measurements was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure (BP) From Baseline in Lisinopril SOC Group
secondary_outcome.description: Lisinopril SOC participants were not given the ambulatory blood pressure machine to obtain readings at home, as was the Lisinopril-naive participants. Instead BP measurements were obtained during screening visit and compared to the Day 14 to 40 visit measurements. Note: these participants were not required to attend a Day 14 (+/-3 day visit) but did need to attend sometime between Day 14 to Day 40 (inclusive). The mean of these blood pressure measurements was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure From Baseline in Lisinopril SOC Group
secondary_outcome.description: Lisinopril SOC participants were not given the ambulatory blood pressure machine to obtain readings at home, as was the Lisinopril-naive participants. Instead BP measurements were obtained during screening visit and compared to the Day 14 to 40 visit measurements (note: the participants were not required to attend a Day 14 (+/-3 day visit) but did need to attend sometime between Day 14 to Day 40. The mean from the blood pressure measurements was calculated.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive study medication for 14±3 days at a dose 0.1 mg/kg/day
Participants will receive study medication for 14±3 days at a dose 0.2 mg/kg/day

Participants will initially receive study medication at 0.2 mg/kg/day for 5±2 days. If blood tests exclude drug-related toxicity, then the lisinopril dose will be increased to 0.4 mg/kg/day and participants will continue to complete the 14±3 day Treatment Period.

intervention.description: Subjects will be randomized to Low, Medium, or High dose of Lisinopril

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Kidney transplant recipient
2. Age 2-17 years, inclusive, at the time of first study dose
3. Estimated GFR (eGFR) ≥30 ml/min/1.73m2, with stable allograft function as indicated by <20% change in serum creatinine in the previous 30 days
4. Stable immunosuppressive regimen, as indicated by <10% change in dosage (in mg/kg) in these medications, within the 14 days prior to enrollment
5. Systolic BP >90th percentile for age, gender, and height, necessitating initiation or addition of an antihypertensive medication
6. For females of child-bearing potential, a negative serum pregnancy test prior to initial dosing and agreement to practice appropriate contraceptive measures, including abstinence, from the time of the initial pregnancy testing through the remainder of the study (30 days after last administration of investigational agents).
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of anaphylaxis attributable to lisinopril or other angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor (ACEI) agents (e.g.,enalapril, ramipril, quinapril)
2. History of anaphylaxis attributable to iohexol or an iodine hypersensitivity
3. Use of an angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor (ACEI), angiotensin receptor blocker, or renin antagonist within 30 days prior to enrollment
4. Stage 2 hypertension defined as the >99th percentile for age, height and gender + 5 mm Hg
5. Blood Potassium value > 6.0 milliequivalent / liter (mEq/L) (as determined at the screening visit)
6. Previous participation in this study
7. Physician concern that the participant may not adhere to the study protocol, based on prior behavior
8. Current plasmapheresis treatment
9. History of angioedema
10. Pregnancy

group.title: Low Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will receive study medication for 14±3 days at a dose 0.1 mg/kg/day

group.title: Medium Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will receive study medication for 14±3 days at a dose 0.2 mg/kg/day

group.title: High Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will initially receive study medication at 0.2 mg/kg/day for 5±2 days. If blood tests exclude drug-related toxicity, then the lisinopril dose will be increased to 0.4 mg/kg/day and participants will continue to complete the 14±3 day Treatment Period.

group.title: Low Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will receive study medication for 14±3 days at a dose 0.1 mg/kg/day

group.title: Medium Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will receive study medication for 14±3 days at a dose 0.2 mg/kg/day

group.title: High Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will initially receive study medication at 0.2 mg/kg/day for 5±2 days. If blood tests exclude drug-related toxicity, then the lisinopril dose will be increased to 0.4 mg/kg/day and participants will continue to complete the 14±3 day Treatment Period.

measure.title: PK - Oral Clearance (CL/F)
measure.description: At the Day 14 (±3 days) visit, blood (1 mL) will be collected at 0 hour (pre-dose) and at 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 12 and 24 hours post-lisinopril dose for determination of CL/F. Geometric mean was calculated from all measurements.

outcome.title: PK Renal Clearance (CLrenal)
outcome.description: At the Day 14 (±3 days) visit, blood (1 mL) will be collected at 0 hour (pre-dose) and at 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 12 and 24 hours post-lisinopril dose for determination of CLrenal. Geometric mean was calculated from all measurements.
outcome.time_frame: Day 14 (+/- 3 d) of dose at 0 hour and 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 12, and 24 hrs after dose.

group.title: Low Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will receive study medication for 14±3 days at a dose 0.1 mg/kg/day

group.title: Medium Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will receive study medication for 14±3 days at a dose 0.2 mg/kg/day

measure.title: PK Renal Clearance (CLrenal)
measure.description: At the Day 14 (±3 days) visit, blood (1 mL) will be collected at 0 hour (pre-dose) and at 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 12 and 24 hours post-lisinopril dose for determination of CLrenal. Geometric mean was calculated from all measurements.

outcome.title: Number of Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) During/After Study Drug Administration
outcome.description: Number of Adverse Events (AEs) related and not related to study drug; number of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) related and not related to study drug
outcome.time_frame: First dose of study drug to 30 days after final study visit for AEs and until resolution for SAEs

group.title: Lisinopril-naive
group.description: These protocol participants were not randomized. Instead, the older age group (7-17 years) were first enrolled consecutively into each dose level, starting with the lowest dose level (0.1 mg/kg per day). After enrollment is complete in the low dose level for an eGFR strata, enrollment will commence for the intermediate (0.2 mg/kg per day) dosage in that strata, followed by the high (0.4 mg/kg per day) dosage level. Enrollment for the 2-6 years age group did not begin until enrollment in the older age group (7-17 years) for the low and intermediate dosage level at each eGFR strata is complete.

group.title: Lisinopril Standard of Care (SOC)
group.description: These protocol participants were enrolled and continued on the lisinopril dose prescribed as standard of care. They were assigned to the appropriate eGFR and dose level stratum (rounding to the closest dose level). Since the lisinopril dose was assigned based on standard of care, a patient was enrolled without regard to open/closed status of the dose stratum in this group. Therefore, over enrollment of a specific dose and eGFR stratum was allowed for participants enrolled he the Lisinopril-naive group to accommodate these valuable low-risk participants already taking lisinopril.

measure.title: Number of Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) During/After Study Drug Administration
measure.description: Number of Adverse Events (AEs) related and not related to study drug; number of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) related and not related to study drug

class.title: AEs not related to study drug
SAE not related to study drug

outcome.title: Largest eGFR Percent Decrease From Baseline in Lisinopril-naive Participants
outcome.description: The eGFR at entry will need to be ≥ 30 ml/min/1.73m^2 to minimize concerns about an acute angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor (ACEI) mediated reduction in kidney function. Largest eGFR percent decrease from baseline reported in results section.

group.title: Low Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will receive study medication for 14±3 days at a dose 0.1 mg/kg/day

group.title: Medium Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will receive study medication for 14±3 days at a dose 0.2 mg/kg/day

group.title: High Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will initially receive study medication at 0.2 mg/kg/day for 5±2 days. If blood tests exclude drug-related toxicity, then the lisinopril dose will be increased to 0.4 mg/kg/day and participants will continue to complete the 14±3 day Treatment Period.

measure.title: Largest eGFR Percent Decrease From Baseline in Lisinopril-naive Participants
measure.description: The eGFR at entry will need to be ≥ 30 ml/min/1.73m^2 to minimize concerns about an acute angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor (ACEI) mediated reduction in kidney function. Largest eGFR percent decrease from baseline reported in results section.

outcome.title: Change in Urine Protein/Creatinine From Baseline in Lisinopril-naive Participants.
outcome.description: Change in urine protein/creatinine obtained as follows: Mean change (worst post-dose from baseline) presented for urine protein/creatinine ratio. Geometric mean of the ratio (worst post-dose / baseline with Geometric Coefficient of Variation percent (CV%) and greatest decrease presented for eGFR by dose group. Two patients in the high dose group had an evaluable urine protein/creatinine change.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to worst post-dose before Day 14 (+/- 3 days)

group.title: Low Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will receive study medication for 14±3 days at a dose 0.1 mg/kg/day

group.title: Medium Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will receive study medication for 14±3 days at a dose 0.2 mg/kg/day

group.title: High Dose: Lisinopril
group.description: Participants will initially receive study medication at 0.2 mg/kg/day for 5±2 days. If blood tests exclude drug-related toxicity, then the lisinopril dose will be increased to 0.4 mg/kg/day and participants will continue to complete the 14±3 day Treatment Period.

measure.title: Change in Urine Protein/Creatinine From Baseline in Lisinopril-naive Participants.
measure.description: Change in urine protein/creatinine obtained as follows: Mean change (worst post-dose from baseline) presented for urine protein/creatinine ratio. Geometric mean of the ratio (worst post-dose / baseline with Geometric Coefficient of Variation percent (CV%) and greatest decrease presented for eGFR by dose group. Two patients in the high dose group had an evaluable urine protein/creatinine change.

outcome.title: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure From Baseline in Lisinopril-naive Participants
outcome.description: Ambulatory blood pressure readings were measured during the baseline/pre-study dose period using a SpaceLabs (Redmond, WA) device at home to avoid the confounding effects of venipuncture and abnormal sleep pattern. Another blood pressure reading was performed at 1 day before the final dose of lisinopril (day before the last scheduled visit). The mean of these measurements was calculated.
outcome.population: Change in diastolic blood pressure from baseline is reported here for lisinopril-naive participants (not the standard of care group which are reported separately).

outcome.title: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure (BP) From Baseline in Lisinopril SOC Group
outcome.description: Lisinopril SOC participants were not given the ambulatory blood pressure machine to obtain readings at home, as was the Lisinopril-naive participants. Instead BP measurements were obtained during screening visit and compared to the Day 14 to 40 visit measurements. Note: these participants were not required to attend a Day 14 (+/-3 day visit) but did need to attend sometime between Day 14 to Day 40 (inclusive). The mean of these blood pressure measurements was calculated.
outcome.population: Change in systolic blood pressure from baseline is reported here for lisinopril SOCparticipants (not the Lisinopril-naive group which are reported separately).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
